metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9445 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the vmnc decoder in the gstreamer allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via large width and height values, which triggers a buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9445` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gst-plugins-bad-1.0 - 1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-hybris - 1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-plugins-bad - 1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-plugins-bad-faad - 1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-plugins-bad-videoparsers - 1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2
libgstreamer-plugins-bad1.0-0 - 1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-bad1.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2').
